Name: LU 56 - Zoning, One 45/Museum of Civil Rights, Manhattan (C 220137(A) ZSM)
Title: Resolution approving a motion to file pursuant to withdrawal of the application regarding the decision of the City Planning Commission on ULURP No. C 220137(A) ZSM, for the grant of a special permit (L.U. No. 56).

History.Description: This Resolution was Filed by Committee
A motion was made that this Resolution be Filed, by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
History.AgendaNote: Coupled to be Filed Pursuant to Letter of Withdrawal
History.MinutesNote: Filed pursuant to a Letter of Withdrawal.

\v0\par
By Council Members Salamanca and Riley\par
\b0\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\qj\tx720\tx7560\tab WHEREAS, \kerning24 One45 Lenox, \kerning0 LLC, filed an application pursuant to Sections 197-c and 201 \kerning24 and proposed for modification pursuant to Section 2-06(c)(1) of the Uniform Land Use Review Procedure of the New York City Charter for the grant of special permits pursuant to Section 74-744(b) of the Zoning Resolution to modify requirements of Section 32-42 (Location Within Buildings) to allow commercial uses (banquet hall use & office amenity space) to be located above residential use, and to modify the requirements of Section 32-423 (Limitation on ground floor location) to allow Use Group 9 uses (banquet hall use) to be located within 50 feet of the street wall of a mixed-use building (Building 1); and Section 74-744(c) of the Zoning Resolution to modify the signage regulations of Section 32-641 (Total Surface Area of Signs), 32-642 (Non-Illuminated Signs), 32-644 (Illuminated or Flashing Signs in C4, C5-4, C6 & C7 Districts), Section 32-652 (Permitted Projection in all other Commercial Districts) and Section 32-655 (Height of Signs in all other Commercial Districts); in connection with a proposed mixed-use development, within a large-scale general development, bounded by West 145\super th\nosupersub  Street, Lenox Avenue - Malcolm X. Boulevard, West 144\super th\nosupersub  Street, a line 100 feet northwesterly of Lenox Avenue - Malcolm X. Boulevard, a line midway between West 144\super th\nosupersub  Street and West 145\super th\nosupersub  Street, and a line 160 feet southeasterly of Adam Clayton Powell Jr. Boulevard (Block 2013, Lots 29, 33, 38, 44 and 50), in a C4-6 District, which in conjunction with the related actions would facilitate the development of a new 32-story, approximately 826,000-square-foot mixed-use building, with approximately 866 to 939 dwelling units; 80,431 to 135,581 square feet of commercial floor area; approximately 44,000 square feet of community facility floor area; and 130 to 141 off-street accessory parking spaces in the Central Harlem neighborhood of Manhattan Community District 10 \kerning0 (ULURP No. C 220137(A) ZSM) (the \ldblquote Application\rdblquote );\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\fi720\qj\f1\par
\f0 WHEREAS, the City Planning Commission filed with the Council on April 25, 2022, its decision dated April 25, 2022 (the \ldblquote Decision\rdblquote ) on the Application;\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\qj\tx720\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\qj\f1\tab\f0 WHEREAS, the Application is related to applications \kerning24 C 220134 ZMM (L.U. No. 53), zoning map amendment to change the current zoning designation of the project area from C8-3 and R7-2/C1-4 zoning districts to a C4-6 zoning district; N 220135 ZRM (L.U. No. 54), zoning text amendment to establish the project area as a Mandatory Inclusionary Housing (MIH) area and to allow, by a special permit, commercial uses above residential units; C 220136 ZSM (L.U. No. 55), special permit to modify the height and setback regulations; and C 220142 ZSM (L.U. No. 57), special permit to modify residential parking regulations;\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\fi-4\ri45\qj\tx720\kerning0\f1\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\fi720\qj\f0 WHEREAS, the Decision is subject to review and action by the Council pursuant to Section 197-d of the City Charter;\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\qj\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\fi720\qj WHEREAS, the City Planning Commission has made the findings required pursuant to Section \kerning24 74-744 \kerning0 of\cf1  t\cf0 he Zoning Resolution of the City of New York;\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\qj\tx0\tx720\tx864\tx2016\tx3168\tx4320\tx5472\tx6624\tx7776\tx8928\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\fi720\qj WHEREAS, upon due notice, the Council held a public hearing on the Decision and Application on May 10, 2022;\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\qj\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\qj\tx720\tab WHEREAS, by submission dated May 31, 2022 and submitted to the Council on May 31, 2022, the Applicant withdrew the application.\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\qj\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\qj\tx0\tx864\tx2016\tx3168\tx4320\tx5472\tx6624\tx7776\tx8928 RESOLVED:\par
\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\qj\tx0\tx720\tx1260\tx1440\tx1620\tab The Council approves the motion to file pursuant to withdrawal in accordance with Rules 7.90 and 11.60(b) of the Rules of the Council.\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\qj\par
\pard\ltrpar\qj Adopted.\par
